attributes.action: The government to help fund St John Ambulance especially at the moment
attributes.additional_details: St John is the nations leading first aid charity and we run off donations however with demands heightened and donations at a low we are running out of money. Many of our volunteers are risking their lives to help the NHS but we don't get any financial help from the government so i want to urge the government to help fund us especially through this tough time as we are apart of keeping the uk running during the current situation
attributes.background: St John is vital at the moment in helping the NHS but we need more funding to help keep up with the current demands.  I am a cadet for St John ambulance and we run off donations only and in this time donations are at a low and we need the support for our volunteers that are helping the NHS

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has announced that St John Ambulance will receive over £6 million to continue to provide life-saving services throughout the outbreak: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/22-million-awarded-to-life-saving-health-charities-during-virus-outbreak

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
